scan_table_check.description: A REST API must be protected against unauthorized external use. The specific security requirements to access the REST API must be specified by a (default) ACL. When creating a new Scripted REST API the default ACL is set to the OOTB ACL "Scripted REST External Default" which limits access to "internal" users - which is obviously not sufficient for the vast majority of use cases.
scan_table_check.name: CodeSanity - REST API must have a default ACL
scan_table_check.resolution_details: Create a specific ACL to control access to the REST API. Ideally a specific role is required which can then be assigned to technical users that should be allowed to access the API. The ACL must be of type "REST_Endpoint" and the operation must be set to "execute".
scan_table_check.short_description: A REST API must specify at least one default ACL
scan_table_check.sys_name: CodeSanity - REST API must have a default ACL
